results.title: A multi-scale area-interaction model for spatio-temporal point patterns
results.abstract: This paper introduces a multi-scale area-interaction model for spatio-temporal point processes, extending the spatial model to a spatio-temporal framework. The model allows for interactions at different scales and the inclusion of covariates. It is applied to varicella cases in Valencia, Spain, revealing small-scale clustering and regularity at larger spatio-temporal scales.

results.title: Spatio-temporal determinantal point processes
results.abstract: This paper introduces spatio-temporal determinantal point processes (STDPPs) as models for regular spatio-temporal point patterns. It presents examples based on both separable and non-separable spatio-temporal covariance functions, providing a new framework for modeling repulsive point patterns in a spatio-temporal context.

results.title: Graphical modelling and partial characteristics for multitype and multivariate-marked spatio-temporal point processes
results.abstract: This paper presents a unified framework for analyzing multivariate and multivariate-marked spatio-temporal point process data. It introduces partial point characteristics and extends the spatial dependence graph model formalism. The proposed graphical model, based on partial spectral density characteristics, is computationally efficient and reflects conditional similarity among spatio-temporal sub-processes.

results.title: Robert Verity, Anne Cori, Swapnil Mishra, Seth Flaxman and Samir Bhatt's contribution to the Discussion of “Some statistical aspects of the Covid-19 response” by Wood et al
results.abstract: The paper discusses the challenges and assumptions in statistical modeling during the COVID-19 pandemic, highlighting issues like media distortion and risk framing. While agreeing on the need for reflection, the authors argue that the deconvolution framework may not be flexible enough for accurately timing infection peaks.

results.title: Model-free machine learning-based 3D single molecule localisation microscopy
results.abstract: This paper presents 'easyZloc,' a 3D single-molecule localization microscopy (SMLM) method using a lightweight Convolutional Neural Network. It is applicable to standard fluorescence microscopes, offering comparable performance to existing methods with reduced computational power and time. The method is demonstrated on nuclear pore complexes, the nuclear envelope, and actin samples.

results.title: Spatio-temporal point processes with deep non-stationary kernels
results.abstract: This paper develops a new deep non-stationary influence kernel for spatio-temporal point processes. The method uses a novel low-rank decomposition and a log-barrier penalty to efficiently model non-stationary dependencies, leading to improved computational efficiency and performance on both simulated and real data.

results.title: Deep Spatio-temporal Point Processes: Advances and New Directions
results.abstract: This article reviews the development of deep influence kernel approaches for spatio-temporal point processes (STPPs). It covers the main components of deep kernel point processes, including functional basis decomposition, graph neural networks for encoding spatial structures, and various estimation methods, while also addressing computational scalability and theoretical foundations.

results.title: Transformer-Based Neural Marked Spatio Temporal Point Process Model for Football Match Events Analysis
results.abstract: This paper proposes a Transformer-Based Neural Marked Spatio Temporal Point Process (NMSTPP) model for football event data. The model outperforms baseline models in prediction performance and is used to propose a new holistic possession utilization score (HPUS) metric for football possession analysis.

results.title: Graphical modelling and partial characteristics for multitype and multivariate-marked spatio-temporal point processes
results.abstract: This paper contributes to the multivariate analysis of marked spatio-temporal point process data by introducing different partial point characteristics and extending the spatial dependence graph model formalism. Our approach yields a unified framework for different types of spatio-temporal data including both, purely qualitatively (multivariate) cases and multivariate cases with additional quantitative marks. The proposed graphical model is defined through partial spectral density characteristics, it is highly computationally efficient and reflects the conditional similarity among sets of spatio-temporal sub-processes of either points or marked points with identical discrete marks.

results.title: Spatio-temporal determinantal point processes
results.abstract: Determinantal point processes are models for regular spatial point patterns, with appealing probabilistic properties. We present their spatio-temporal counterparts and give examples of these models, based on spatio-temporal covariance functions which are separable and non-separable in space and time.

results.title: A multi-scale area-interaction model for spatio-temporal point patterns
results.abstract: This paper proposes an extension of the spatial multi-scale area-interaction model to a spatio-temporal framework. This model allows for interaction between points at different spatio-temporal scales and the inclusion of covariates. We fit the proposed model to varicella cases registered during 2013 in Valencia, Spain. The fitted model indicates small scale clustering and regularity for higher spatio-temporal scales.

results.title: Spatio-temporal point processes with deep non-stationary kernels
results.abstract: This paper develops a new deep non-stationary influence kernel for spatio-temporal point processes. The method uses a novel low-rank decomposition and a log-barrier penalty to efficiently model non-stationary dependencies, improving performance and computational efficiency compared to state-of-the-art methods.

results.title: Deep Spatio-temporal Point Processes: Advances and New Directions
results.abstract: This article reviews the development of deep influence kernel approaches for spatio-temporal point processes (STPPs). It covers functional basis decomposition, graph neural networks for complex structures, and both likelihood-based and likelihood-free estimation methods, highlighting applications in various fields.

results.title: Transformer-Based Neural Marked Spatio Temporal Point Process Model for Football Match Events Analysis
results.abstract: This paper proposes a Transformer-Based Neural Marked Spatio Temporal Point Process (NMSTPP) model for football event data. It introduces the holistic possession utilization score (HPUS) metric for a more comprehensive analysis of football possessions, outperforming baseline models in prediction performance.

results.title: Point-process modeling of secondary crashes | PLOS One
results.abstract: In this work, we developed a self-exciting temporal point process to analyze crash events data and classify it into primary and secondary crashes.

results.title: The most distant $γ$-ray flare to date: a multiwavelength campaign on the $z = 4.715$ blazar GB6 B1428+4217
results.abstract: In November 2023, the Fermi Large Area Telescope detected a $\gamma$-ray flare from the high-redshift blazar GB6 B1428+4217 ($z=4.715$). We initiated a multi-wavelength follow-up campaign involving Swift, NuSTAR, the Sierra Nevada and Perkins Observatories, and the Effelsberg 100-m radio telescope. This source, also known as 5BZQ J1430+4204, has shown an anomalous soft X-ray spectrum in previous observations, including possible ionized absorption features or signatures of bulk Comptonization of

results.title: Advancing Event Forecasting through Massive Training of Large Language Models: Challenges, Solutions, and Broader Impacts
results.abstract: Many recent papers have studied the development of superforecaster-level event forecasting LLMs. While methodological problems with early studies cast doubt on the use of LLMs for event forecasting, recent studies with improved evaluation methods have shown that state-of-the-art LLMs are gradually reaching superforecaster-level performance, and reinforcement learning has also been reported to improve future forecasting. Additionally, the unprecedented success of recent reasoning models and Deep

results.title: NANOGrav 15-year Data Set: Search for Gravitational Scattering of Pulsars by Free-Floating Objects in Interstellar Space
results.abstract: Free-floating objects (FFOs) in interstellar space$-$rogue planets, brown dwarfs, and large asteroids that are not gravitationally bound to any star$-$are expected to be ubiquitous throughout the Milky Way. Recent microlensing surveys have discovered several free-floating planets that are not bound to any known stellar systems. Additionally, three interstellar objects, namely 1I/'Oumuamua, 2I/Borisov, and 3I/ATLAS, have been detected passing through our solar system on hyperbolic trajectories. I

results.title: Measuring the Unmeasurable? Systematic Evidence on Scale Transformations in Subjective Survey Data
results.abstract: Economists routinely use survey measures of, for example, risk preferences, trust, political attitudes, or wellbeing. The literature generally treats numerical response categories as if they represent equal psychological intervals. We provide the first systematic test of this assumption, developing a general framework to quantify how easily results can be overturned when this linearity assumption is relaxed. Using original experimental data, we show that respondents interpret survey scales in ways that challenge the linearity assumption, and that this can have a substantial impact on empirical findings.

results.title: PLOS A mechanistic spatio-temporal framework for modelling individual-to-individual transmission—With an application to the 2014-2015 West Africa Ebola outbreak | PLOS Computational Biology
results.abstract: This article presents a mechanistic spatio-temporal framework for modeling the transmission of infectious diseases from one individual to another. The model is applied to the 2014-2015 Ebola outbreak in West Africa, demonstrating how it can be used to understand the dynamics of an epidemic by considering the specific locations and timings of transmissions. The method involves detailed calculations of spatial infectivity between individuals, offering a more granular view compared to traditional models.

results.title: PLOS An Accessible Method for Implementing Hierarchical Models with Spatio-Temporal Abundance Data | PLOS One
results.abstract: In ecology, understanding population dynamics across large areas and long times is a key goal. This paper presents an accessible method for creating hierarchical models that can analyze spatio-temporal abundance data, helping researchers to overcome common assumptions and make better inferences about how and why animal and plant populations vary.

results.title: PLOS Understanding spatiotemporal patterns of COVID-19 incidence in Portugal: A functional data analysis from August 2020 to March 2022 | PLOS One
results.abstract: Using data on confirmed COVID-19 cases in Portugal, this study applies functional data analysis to understand the spatiotemporal dynamics of the pandemic. The research provides scientific insights into how the incidence rates varied across different locations and times, leveraging the massive datasets collected by public health authorities.

results.title: Let It Go? Not Quite: Addressing Item Cold Start in Sequential Recommendations with Content-Based Initialization
results.abstract: Many sequential recommender systems suffer from the cold start problem, where items with few or no interactions cannot be effectively used by the model due to the absence of a trained embedding. Content-based approaches, which leverage item metadata, are commonly used in such scenarios. One possible way is to use embeddings derived from content features such as textual descriptions as initialization for the model embeddings. However, directly using frozen content embeddings often results in subo

results.title: Back to the Features: DINO as a Foundation for Video World Models
results.abstract: We present DINO-world, a powerful generalist video world model trained to predict future frames in the latent space of DINOv2. By leveraging a pre-trained image encoder and training a future predictor on a large-scale uncurated video dataset, DINO-world learns the temporal dynamics of diverse scenes, from driving and indoor scenes to simulated environments. We show that DINO-world outperforms previous models on a variety of video prediction benchmarks, e.g. segmentation and depth forecasting, an

results.title: Reconstructing 4D Spatial Intelligence: A Survey
results.abstract: Reconstructing 4D spatial intelligence from visual observations has long been a central yet challenging task in computer vision, with broad real-world applications. These range from entertainment domains like movies, where the focus is often on reconstructing fundamental visual elements, to embodied AI, which emphasizes interaction modeling and physical realism. Fueled by rapid advances in 3D representations and deep learning architectures, the field has evolved quickly, outpacing the scope of p

results.title: Spatio-temporal characterization of earthquake sequence...
results.abstract: Point process modeling can be used to better understand potential interactions between earthquakes and spatial features, temporal features, and

results.title: GPT-IMAGE-EDIT-1.5M: A Million-Scale, GPT-Generated Image Dataset
results.abstract: Recent advancements in large multimodal models like GPT-4o have set a new standard for high-fidelity, instruction-guided image editing. However, the proprietary nature of these models and their training data creates a significant barrier for open-source research. To bridge this gap, we introduce GPT-IMAGE-EDIT-1.5M, a publicly available, large-scale image-editing corpus containing more than 1.5 million high-quality triplets (instruction, source image, edited image). We systematically construct t

results.title: A Spatio-Temporal Point Process for Fine-Grained Modeling of Reading Behavior
results.abstract: This paper introduces a spatio-temporal point process model to analyze reading behavior, capturing the dynamics of eye movements (fixations and saccades) to better understand online sentence processing. This approach moves beyond traditional aggregated eye-tracking measurements, offering a more fine-grained and detailed analysis of reading patterns.

results.title: What Influences the Field Goal Attempts of Professional Players? Analysis of Basketball Shot Charts via Log Gaussian Cox Processes with Spatially Varying Coefficients
results.abstract: This study analyzes basketball shot charts using Log Gaussian Cox Processes with spatially varying coefficients to understand the factors influencing shot attempts. By modeling shot locations as a marked spatio-temporal point process, the paper provides insights into offensive and defensive strategies and player performance, offering a sophisticated approach to sports analytics.

results.title: Fine-grained Spatio-temporal Event Prediction with Self-adaptive Anchor Graph
results.abstract: This paper presents a new model for fine-grained spatio-temporal event prediction that addresses the challenges of spatial heterogeneity and correlations. The proposed self-adaptive anchor graph method aims to improve the accuracy of predicting event occurrences in continuous space by learning spatial dependencies more effectively than existing state-of-the-art models.

results.title: PLOS Recurrent spatio-temporal modeling of check-ins in location-based social networks | PLOS ONE
results.abstract: This paper explores the use of recurrent spatio-temporal models to understand user behavior in location-based social networks. It focuses on modeling check-in data, showcasing the application of point process models in analyzing human mobility and social patterns.

results.title: Registration of spatio-temporal point clouds of plants for phenotyping
results.abstract: This paper investigates the problem of registering 3D point clouds of plants over time and space, a key challenge in plant phenotyping. The authors propose a novel method for aligning these spatio-temporal point clouds to enable the study of plant growth and development.

results.title: A mechanistic and deep learning study | PLOS Computational Biology
results.abstract: This study proposes a novel modeling framework that integrates spatio-temporal heterogeneity of susceptible individuals into homogeneous models. This is a significant contribution to the field of epidemiology and disease modeling.

results.title: Evaluating and implementing temporal, spatial, and spatio-temporal ...
results.abstract: This paper provides a comprehensive evaluation of various temporal, spatial, and spatio-temporal methods. The authors discuss the implementation of these methods in R, WinBUGS, and SaTScan, offering practical guidance for researchers.

results.title: Spatio-temporal modeling of the crowding conditions and metabolic ...
results.abstract: This research investigates how crowding conditions and metabolic variability among cells shape the dynamics of microbial communities. The authors use spatio-temporal modeling to explore these complex interactions.

results.title: Self-Organization of Spatio-Temporal Hierarchy via Learning ... - PLOS
results.abstract: This study introduces a method for contextual recognition of dynamic visual image patterns using a self-organizing spatio-temporal hierarchy. This has potential applications in computer vision and pattern recognition.

results.title: When Proximity Falls Short: Inequalities in Commuting and Accessibility by Public Transport in Santiago, Chile
results.abstract: This study uses mobile phone data (eXtended Detail Records) to analyze commuting patterns and accessibility in Santiago, Chile. By modeling residential and work locations and commuting routes, the authors reveal inequalities in public transport accessibility, highlighting the limitations of traditional static models.

results.title: An empirical comparison of some outlier detection methods with longitudinal data
results.abstract: This paper compares various outlier detection methods for longitudinal data, drawing from official statistics, data mining, and machine learning. The study applies these methods to panel survey data, evaluating their effectiveness in identifying potential outliers and discussing their respective strengths and weaknesses.

results.title: Local Poisson Deconvolution for Discrete Signals
results.abstract: We analyze the statistical problem of recovering an atomic signal, modeled as a discrete uniform distribution, from a binned Poisson convolution model. This question is motivated, among others, by super-resolution laser microscopy applications, where precise estimation of the signal provides insights into spatial formations of cellular protein assemblies. Our main results quantify the local minimax risk of estimating the signal for a broad class of smooth convolution kernels.

results.title: Generative AI in Higher Education: Evidence from an Elite College
results.abstract: This study uses survey data from a selective U.S. college to document the adoption of generative AI among students. It finds that over 80% of students use AI for academic purposes, with usage varying across disciplines and demographics. The paper explores how AI is used for learning and its potential impact on educational inequalities.

results.title: Stochastic Taylor expansion via Poisson point processes
results.abstract: This paper introduces a generalization of Taylor's theorem using a stochastic formulation based on a Poisson point process model. This approach is used to propose a novel non-linear regression framework and perform statistical inference on the model parameters. The authors prove theoretical properties of the proposed estimator, including its convergence to the true function. The theory is presented for both univariate and multivariate cases.

results.title: Detection and analysis of spatiotemporal patterns in brain activity
results.abstract: Research Article: Detection and analysis of spatiotemporal patterns in brain activity. Rory G. Townsend, Pulin Gong.

results.title: Event Detection using Twitter: A Spatio-Temporal Approach
results.abstract: This paper suggests an alternative methodology for event detection using space-time scan statistics (STSS). It has been found that not only can STSS be applied to Twitter, but that abnormal space time clusters did exist within Twitter relating to the London helicopter crash disaster, as well as other space-time events such as sport fixtures and train delays.

results.title: A Methodological Framework and Questionnaire for Investigating Perceived Algorithmic Fairness
results.abstract: This study explores perceptions of fairness in algorithmic decision-making among users in Bangladesh through a comprehensive mixed-methods approach. By integrating quantitative survey data with qualitative interview insights, we examine how cultural, social, and contextual factors influence users' understanding of fairness, transparency, and accountability in AI systems.

results.title: Understanding Heterogeneity in Adaptation to Intermittent Water Supply: Clustering Household Types in Amman, Jordan
results.abstract: This paper uses survey data to study how households in Amman, Jordan adapt to intermittent water supply (IWS). The authors use a clustering approach to group households based on their adaptation strategies and explore the factors that lead to different levels of adaptation and inequality.

results.title: Debiasing Machine Learning Predictions for Causal Inference Without Additional Ground Truth Data: 'One Map, Many Trials' in Satellite-Driven Poverty Analysis
results.abstract: This paper addresses the issue of shrinkage in machine learning models trained on satellite imagery to predict wealth indices. The authors propose a method to debias these predictions, which is crucial for accurate causal inference in poverty analysis. The approach is demonstrated in the context of creating high-resolution wealth maps from satellite data.

results.title: Pheno4D: A spatio-temporal dataset of maize and tomato plant point clouds
results.abstract: This paper introduces Pheno4D, a spatio-temporal dataset of maize and tomato plant point clouds. This dataset can be used for applications such as tracking different phenotypic traits for the plants and quantifying their performance over time.

results.title: LiDO: Discovery of a 10:1 Resonator with a Novel Libration State
results.abstract: The Large inclination Distant Objects (LiDO) survey discovered a new object, 2020 VN40, in the 10:1 mean motion resonance of Neptune. This paper reports on the discovery from the survey data, confirming that this distant resonance is populated, which is a significant finding in planetary science.

results.title: Feature-Wise Mixing for Mitigating Contextual Bias in Predictive Supervised Learning
results.abstract: This paper introduces a feature-wise mixing framework to mitigate contextual bias in predictive machine learning models. The method aims to redistribute feature representations across different groups to reduce the influence of sensitive attributes on predictions, thereby improving fairness and model generalizability.

results.title: Unified Flow Matching for Long Horizon Event Forecasting
results.abstract: This paper proposes a unified flow matching framework for marked temporal point processes, enabling non-autoregressive, long-horizon event forecasting. This approach addresses the limitations of traditional autoregressive models, which are prone to error accumulation and inefficiency in long-range predictions, making it suitable for applications in healthcare, finance, and user behavior modeling.

results.title: A multi-stage Bayesian approach to fit spatial point process models
results.abstract: This paper introduces a flexible and efficient multi-stage recursive Bayesian approach for fitting spatial point process (SPP) models. The proposed method leverages parallel computing to streamline the estimation of model coefficients, addressing the computational expense of traditional methods and making it particularly useful for analyzing presence-only data in ecological studies.

results.title: Spatio-Temporal Variation of Conversational Utterances on Twitter
results.abstract: Conversations reflect the existing norms of a language. Previously, we found that utterance lengths in English fictional conversations in books and movies follow a log-normal distribution with a relatively stable mode of 3-4 seconds. Here we analyze the spatio-temporal variation of this mode on the social media platform Twitter.

results.title: Combining Spatial-Temporal and Phylogenetic Analysis for comprehensive understanding of pathogen evolution and spread
results.abstract: We report an interdisciplinary effort that combines the geospatial informatics approach with a bioinformatics approach to form an improved understanding on the evolution and spread of a pathogen. We used the H5N1 avian influenza virus as a case study. Our study demonstrated that the combined phylogenetic and spatial-temporal analysis approach can provide a comprehensive and improved understanding of the evolution and spread of a pathogen.

results.title: Scenic area attractiveness in Dali City and its influencing factors based on multi-source spatiotemporal data
results.abstract: Scenic area attractiveness is a core factor in urban tourism development. Developments in social media and multi-source spatiotemporal data provide a basis for studying scenic area attractiveness. This study uses multi-source spatiotemporal data to analyze the attractiveness of scenic areas in Dali City and its influencing factors.

results.title: Doubly robust integration of nonprobability and probability survey data
results.abstract: This paper proposes several doubly robust estimators for integrating outcome and covariate data from a nonprobability survey with covariate data from an auxiliary probability survey. The authors address the challenge of combining a doubly robust estimate with an estimate based on outcome data from the auxiliary probability survey, which is a key issue in survey data analysis.

results.title: Spatio-Temporal distribution characteristics and driving factors of Chinese cultural heritage tourism routes in the past 20 years
results.abstract: This study analyzes the spatio-temporal distribution characteristics of Chinese cultural heritage tourism routes over the last two decades. It identifies the key driving factors that have influenced the spatial and temporal evolution of these tourism routes.

results.title: Accurate disaster entity recognition based on contextual information and multi-task learning
results.abstract: This study focuses on the automatic extraction of disaster-related named entities from a dataset of 1000 annotated online news articles. By leveraging contextual information and a multi-task learning framework, the research aims to improve the accuracy of disaster entity recognition, which is crucial for emergency response and disaster management.

results.title: WGAST: Weakly-Supervised Generative Network for Daily 10 m Land Surface Temperature Estimation via Spatio-Temporal Fusion
results.abstract: This paper presents WGAST, a weakly-supervised generative network for estimating daily Land Surface Temperature (LST) at a high spatial resolution (10 m) using spatio-temporal fusion. This method addresses the trade-off between spatial and temporal resolution in remote sensing satellites. The proposed solution is particularly relevant for environmental monitoring applications, which are increasingly important due to urbanization, climate change, and agricultural stress.

results.title: Effective Training Data Synthesis for Improving MLLM Chart Understanding
results.abstract: This paper addresses the challenge of improving chart understanding in multimodal large language models (MLLMs). The authors propose a method for synthesizing effective training data that more closely resembles real-world charts, which is a key limitation of existing approaches. This work is significant for advancing the capabilities of AI agents in scientific and data analysis domains.

results.title: Non-programmers Assessing AI-Generated Code: A Case Study of Business Users Analyzing Data
results.abstract: This study investigates the ability of non-technical users, specifically marketing and sales professionals, to evaluate the correctness of AI-generated code for data analysis. The research uses a survey methodology to assess how well these users can identify errors in LLM-generated analyses of marketing data. The findings are crucial for understanding the reliability of AI-powered tools in business contexts.

results.title: Identifying nonequilibrium degrees of freedom in high-dimensional stochastic systems
results.abstract: Standard methods for reducing the dimensionality of nonequilibrium systems often prioritize reconstruction accuracy over physical relevance. This paper introduces a model-free method to identify the key irreversible degrees of freedom within high-dimensional stochastic systems in a nonequilibrium steady state. The approach uniquely trains a classifier to distinguish between forward and time-reversed system dynamics, thereby isolating the components essential for understanding the system's irreversible behavior.

results.title: Mitigating incoherent excess variance in high-redshift 21-cm observations with multi-output cross Gaussian process regression
results.abstract: A major challenge in 21-cm cosmology is the contamination of the faint cosmological signal by bright astrophysical foregrounds and other systematic effects. This paper presents a novel method to mitigate incoherent excess variance in radio interferometric data, which can mimic the 21-cm signal. The proposed solution uses multi-output cross Gaussian process regression to model and subtract this contaminant, thereby improving the sensitivity of low-frequency radio telescopes for observing the high-redshift universe.

results.title: Multi-dimensional perceptual recognition of tourist destination using online travelogue data: A case study of Chinese tourists in Nordic countries
results.abstract: This paper analyzes the spatio-temporal behavior of Chinese tourists in Nordic countries using geo-located travel blog data. The study aims to understand the multi-dimensional perceptual recognition of tourist destinations from the perspective of tourists. It provides a methodology for analyzing user-generated content to gain insights into tourism patterns and destination perception.

results.title: Multi-scale spatio-temporal analysis of human mobility
results.abstract: This paper presents a multi-scale spatio-temporal analysis of human mobility by examining the digital traces of approximately 850 individuals over 25 months. The study characterizes mobility behavior across different magnitudes, providing insights into the patterns of human movement. The findings are relevant for urban planning, epidemiology, and other fields that rely on understanding human mobility.

results.title: Spatial and temporal characteristics analysis and prediction model of urban road traffic flow based on ST-Informer: A case study of Beijing
results.abstract: This paper proposes a novel spatiotemporal prediction model, ST-Informer, to analyze and predict urban road traffic flow. Using Beijing as a case study, the research explores the spatial and temporal characteristics of traffic and develops a model to forecast traffic flow. The study addresses the shortcomings of existing spatiotemporal prediction models and offers a new approach for traffic management and urban planning.

results.title: Spatio-Temporal Analysis of Micro Economic Activities in Rome: A Twitter-Based Approach
results.abstract: This study uses Twitter data to conduct a spatio-temporal analysis of micro-economic activities in Rome. The research demonstrates how social media data can provide insights into urbanization processes and economic trends. The paper's findings are valuable for understanding the dynamics of urban economies and the role of social media in economic analysis.

results.title: Contextual factors predicting compliance behavior during the COVID-19 pandemic: A machine learning analysis on survey data from 16 countries
results.abstract: This paper investigates the contextual factors that predict compliance behavior during the COVID-19 pandemic. Using a machine learning analysis of survey data from 16 countries, the study identifies key predictors of compliance with public health measures. The findings are crucial for understanding how to promote public health compliance during a pandemic.

results.title: Integrative context-dependent clustering for heterogeneous datasets
results.abstract: This paper introduces a novel algorithm for integrative, context-dependent clustering of heterogeneous multilevel data. The method is designed to handle complex datasets by incorporating contextual information into the clustering process. This approach is valuable for a wide range of applications where data from multiple sources and levels need to be analyzed together.

results.title: Exploring spatial variations and the individual and contextual factors of uptake of measles-containing second dose vaccine among children aged 24–35 months in Nigeria: A cross-sectional study
results.abstract: This cross-sectional study explores the spatial variations and the individual and contextual factors influencing the uptake of the second dose of the measles vaccine in Nigeria. The research provides insights into the challenges of vaccination programs and the factors that need to be addressed to improve vaccine coverage. The findings are important for public health policy and intervention design.

results.title: Echo-4o: Harnessing the Power of GPT-4o Synthetic Images for Improved Image Generation
results.abstract: This paper explores the use of synthetic image data generated by GPT-4o to enhance open-source image generation models. The authors identify the advantages of using synthetic data over real-world image datasets and propose methods to harness the power of GPT-4o for this purpose.

results.title: On the Consistency and Performance of the Iterative Bayesian Update
results.abstract: Estimating the distribution of sensitive user data is crucial for many applications. This paper analyzes the use of local privacy protection mechanisms, where users release a noisy version of their data. The original distribution is then estimated from this sanitized data. The work focuses on the consistency and performance of the Iterative Bayesian Update method for this estimation.

results.title: A Survey on 3D Gaussian Splatting Applications: Segmentation, Editing, and Generation
results.abstract: This survey provides a comprehensive overview of the applications of 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS), a technique for 3D scene representation. The paper covers downstream applications that require geometric and semantic understanding, such as segmentation, editing, and generation, highlighting the potential of 3DGS in these areas.

results.title: Masquerade: Learning from In-the-wild Human Videos using Data-Editing
results.abstract: This paper introduces Masquerade, a novel method for learning robot manipulation from in-the-wild human videos. The approach involves editing these videos to bridge the visual embodiment gap between humans and robots, effectively creating a new dataset for training robot policies. This work addresses the data scarcity problem in robot manipulation research.

results.title: The Neural Hawkes Process: A Neurally Self-Modulating Multivariate Point Process
results.abstract: A Hawkes process is a type of self-exciting point process where the arrival of an event increases the probability of future events. The Neural Hawkes Process is a novel approach that uses a neural network to model the intensity function of a multivariate point process. This allows for more flexible and expressive models of event dynamics compared to traditional parametric models. The model uses a continuous-time LSTM to learn the history of events and predict the time and type of the next event. This is a highly innovative and useful paper that has spurred much follow-up research.

results.title: Uncovering the Missing Pattern: A Novel Cross-modal Fusion based Spatio-temporal Prediction Model
results.abstract: This paper proposes a new model for spatio-temporal prediction that can handle missing data by using cross-modal fusion. The model, called Cross-modal Fusion Spatio-temporal Prediction (CFSTP), uses a novel attention mechanism to fuse information from different modalities and a new loss function to handle missing data. The authors demonstrate the effectiveness of their model on several real-world datasets, showing that it outperforms existing methods in terms of prediction accuracy and robustness to missing data. This is a very useful paper for anyone working with real-world spatio-temporal data, which often suffers from missing values.

results.title: A Survey on Datasets for Spatio-Temporal Data Mining
results.abstract: This paper provides a comprehensive survey of datasets used in spatio-temporal data mining research. The authors categorize the datasets based on their data types, application domains, and spatio-temporal characteristics. They also provide a detailed description of each dataset, including its size, source, and any associated tasks. This survey is a valuable resource for researchers looking for suitable datasets to evaluate their spatio-temporal data mining algorithms. It is highly useful for anyone starting a new project in this area.

results.title: Human-in-Context: Unified Cross-Domain 3D Human Motion Modeling via In-Context Learning
results.abstract: This paper proposes a unified model for 3D human motion across different domains, such as various modalities, tasks, and datasets. The authors introduce a novel in-context learning approach to train a single model that can handle this diversity without requiring domain-specific components or multi-stage training. This is a significant step towards more general and scalable models for human motion analysis, which is a key component of many spatio-temporal applications. The idea of a unified model is very innovative and useful.

results.title: A Dataset for Distilling Knowledge Priors from Literature for Therapeutic Design
results.abstract: This paper introduces a new dataset of priors for therapeutic design, which are distilled from the scientific literature. The authors argue that AI-driven drug discovery can be improved by incorporating such priors, which can help to avoid violating implicit constraints and generating unsafe molecules. While not directly related to spatio-temporal data, this paper is highly relevant to the concept of contextual datasets. The idea of distilling knowledge from literature to create a contextual dataset is very innovative and could be applied to other domains, including spatio-temporal analysis.

results.title: A machine learning-driven behavioural analysis of co-working space
results.abstract: This article discusses the use of machine learning in the analysis of co-working spaces, a clear example of spatio-temporal data analysis. It explores how understanding the patterns of space usage over time can lead to better management and design of these spaces. The study uses various data sources to model the behavior of users within the co-working environment, providing insights into the dynamics of shared workspaces.

results.title: Event Detection using Twitter: A Spatio-Temporal Approach
results.abstract: This post explores the use of Twitter data for event detection through a spatio-temporal lens. It demonstrates how analyzing the location and time of tweets can help in identifying and monitoring events as they unfold. The methodology presented can be applied to various scenarios, from disaster management to tracking social trends, showcasing the power of social media as a source of real-time spatio-temporal data.

results.title: Modeling the spread of fake news on Twitter | PLOS One
results.abstract: This study proposes a point process model to describe the spread of fake news on Twitter. This is a modern and highly relevant application of point process models, demonstrating their utility in understanding information diffusion in social networks. The model captures the dynamics of how fake news spreads over time and through the network.

results.title: Learning temporal attention in dynamic graphs with bilinear...
results.abstract: This paper presents a model based on temporal point processes and variational autoencoders to learn temporal attention between nodes in dynamic graphs. This is a sophisticated use of point process models in the context of machine learning and network analysis, offering a new way to understand the evolution of relationships in dynamic systems.

results.title: MAESTRO: Masked AutoEncoders for Multimodal, Multitemporal, and Multispectral Earth Observation Data
results.abstract: This paper presents MAESTRO, a novel Masked Autoencoder adapted for multimodal, multitemporal, and multispectral Earth observation data. It benchmarks fusion strategies and normalization schemes to handle the unique characteristics of this data type for self-supervised learning.

results.title: Neural Spatiotemporal Point Processes: Trends and Challenges
results.abstract: Spatiotemporal point processes (STPPs) are probabilistic models for events that occur in continuous space and time. Real-world event data often exhibit complex dependencies and heterogeneous dynamics. By incorporating modern deep learning techniques, STPPs can model these complexities more effectively than traditional approaches. As a result, the fusion of neural methods with STPPs has become an active and rapidly evolving area of research. In this review, we categorize existing approaches, unify the field, and identify key trends and challenges.

results.title: Assessing the contagiousness of mass shootings with a point process model
results.abstract: This study uses a point process model to assess the contagiousness of mass shootings. A point process is a random collection of points occurring in some metric space, often in a temporal or spatio-temporal context. The model helps to determine if one mass shooting increases the probability of another one happening in the near future.

results.title: On the stability and dynamics of stochastic spiking neuron models
results.abstract: Point process generalized linear models (PP-GLMs) provide an important statistical framework for modeling spiking activity in single-neurons and neuronal networks. This paper investigates the stability and dynamics of such models, which is crucial for understanding the computational properties of neural systems.

results.title: Implementing machine learning methods with complex survey data: Lessons learned on the impacts of accounting sampling weights in gradient boosting
results.abstract: This paper explores the application of machine learning methods, specifically gradient boosting, to complex survey data. Using data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey, the authors investigate the impact of ignoring sampling weights on the model's predictive performance. The findings provide valuable lessons for researchers working with complex survey data and machine learning algorithms.

results.title: Indicators to Examine Quality of Large Scale Survey Data
results.abstract: This paper discusses various indicators used to examine the quality of large-scale survey data. The authors focus on age misreporting, incompleteness, and inconsistency of information as key quality indicators. The paper provides a framework for assessing the quality of survey data, which is crucial for ensuring the validity and reliability of research findings.

results.title: Risky Business: Factor Analysis of Survey Data
results.abstract: This paper undertakes a systematic assessment of the extent to which factor analysis can correctly identify the number of latent dimensions (factors) when applied to ordered-categorical survey data. The study highlights the potential risks and challenges associated with using factor analysis with survey data and provides recommendations for best practices.

results.title: MAESTRO: Masked AutoEncoders for Multimodal, Multitemporal, and Multispectral Earth Observation Data
results.abstract: A blog post discussing the MAESTRO paper, which introduces a self-supervised learning method for Earth observation data. The method uses a masked autoencoder to handle multimodal, multitemporal, and multispectral satellite imagery, learning rich representations for downstream tasks like land cover classification.

results.title: Neural field models for latent state inference - Research journals
results.abstract: The paper presents a method to interpret neural field models as latent state-space point-process models. This approach, based on moment closure, makes these models amenable to statistical analysis and allows for the inference of latent states from neural data. This provides a new framework for understanding the computational principles of neural field models.

results.title: Spatio-Temporal analysis of exports of cultural products and their ...
results.abstract: This study uses Exploratory Spatial Data Analysis (ESDA) to analyze the spatial patterns and relationships of cultural product exports. The methodology focuses on understanding the underlying spatial structures and distributions of the data, providing insights into the geographic concentrations and dispersions of cultural exports.

results.title: Applying spatio-temporal models to assess variations across health ...
results.abstract: The paper discusses the application of various spatio-temporal models for disease mapping. It highlights the development of several methods over the last two decades to model and understand the complex spatio-temporal data structures in public health, allowing for the assessment of variations in health outcomes across different regions and time periods.

results.title: A Four Dimensional Spatio-Temporal Analysis of an Agricultural ...
results.abstract: This article reviews primary temporal modeling approaches such as random walk and autoregressive models, as well as penalised spline smoothers. It acknowledges the complexity of spatio-temporal analysis and discusses these methods as foundational techniques for modeling temporal dependencies in four-dimensional agricultural data.

results.title: Measurement and spatiotemporal analysis of high-quality ...
results.abstract: The paper introduces the natural breakpoint method as a data clustering technique for spatio-temporal analysis. This method aims to find the best grouping of different categories by minimizing the average deviation from the mean within each group, thus effectively identifying natural clusters in the data.

results.title: Spatial-Temporal Analysis of Environmental Data of North Beijing ...
results.abstract: This work demonstrates the use of Empirical Mode Decomposition (EMD) and Ensemble Empirical Mode Decomposition (EEMD) techniques for detecting abnormal values in environmental data. The study shows that the strong localized spectrum information provided by these methods allows for easy identification of anomalies in spatio-temporal datasets.

results.title: A Granger Causality Measure for Point Process Models of Ensemble ...
results.abstract: This paper introduces a point process framework that allows the application of Granger causality to point process data, such as neural spike trains. This enables the analysis of causal relationships within ensembles of neurons, providing a new tool for understanding neural circuits.

results.title: Robust point-process Granger causality analysis in presence of ...
results.abstract: The paper discusses Granger causality techniques for point-process data that overcome common problems in the analysis. By directly modeling the conditional intensity function (CIF) of neurons, these methods can be robustly applied to analyze causal interactions in neural data.

results.title: A Unified Approach to Linking Experimental, Statistical and ...
results.abstract: This article applies a standard point process analysis paradigm, constructing both descriptive statistics and a simple statistical model. The goal is to provide a unified approach that links experimental data with statistical analysis and theoretical models.

results.title: Point process analysis of noise in early invertebrate vision
results.abstract: This paper provides a comprehensive analysis of the relative impact of intrinsic and extrinsic noise in invertebrate phototransduction. Using point process analysis, the study investigates the sources and effects of noise in the early stages of the visual system.

results.title: LERCause: Deep learning approaches for causal sentence ...
results.abstract: The authors introduce LERCause, a labeled dataset for the classification of causal sentences. This dataset, combined with specific labeling methods, is intended to serve as a benchmark for developing and evaluating deep learning models for causal sentence detection.

results.title: Exploiting contextual information to improve call prediction | PLOS One
results.abstract: This study analyzes important dimensions of contextual information to predict which contact a user will call at a specific time. The research demonstrates that leveraging contextual data can significantly improve the accuracy of call prediction models.

results.title: Recurrent spatio-temporal modeling of check-ins in location-based ...
results.abstract: This paper introduces a recurrent spatio-temporal model for check-ins in location-based social networks. It uses a periodic point process to capture the recurrent patterns of user visits to different locations.

results.title: A machine learning analysis on survey data from 16 countries - PLOS
results.abstract: This research uses machine learning to analyze survey data from 16 countries, focusing on predicting leaving home.

results.title: A data science analysis of the World Values Survey | PLOS One
results.abstract: This study uses a data science approach to discover quantitative social dimensions from the World Values Survey.
results.title: 4DNeX: Feed-Forward 4D Generative Modeling Made Easy
results.abstract: This paper presents 4DNeX, a feed-forward framework for generating 4D (dynamic 3D) scene representations from a single image. Unlike existing methods that are computationally expensive or require multi-frame inputs, 4DNeX allows for efficient, end-to-end image-to-4D generation by fine-tuning a pretrained video diffusion model. To address the scarcity of 4D data, the authors constructed 4DNeX-10M, a large-scale dataset with high-quality 4D annotations.

results.title: Training Machine Learning Models on Human Spatio-temporal Mobility Data: An Experimental Study [Experiment Paper]
results.abstract: This paper explores the under-researched problem of predicting individual-level human mobility patterns, focusing on macro-level life routines rather than short-term trajectories. The study has applications in infectious disease monitoring, as well as child and elderly care. The authors conduct an experimental study on training machine learning models on human spatio-temporal mobility data.
